column1: TA3.51;The targets should in principle be reached
column2: especially if other incentives on demand of recycled plastics promote the wide deployment of post-shredder sorting technologies.;TA6.29;+;The implementation of TA3.51 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.29
column3: as the increased recycling of plastics can lead to a reduction in waste and pollution
column4: which can in turn contribute to the restoration of ecosystems and biodiversity. This is because the reduction of plastic waste can help to decrease the amount of microplastics in the environment
column5: which can harm marine life and ecosystems.

column1: TA3.52;At least 20% of the carbon used in the chemical and plastic products should be from sustainable non-fossil sources by 2030;TA6.30;+;The implementation of TA3.52 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.30
column2: as the increased use of sustainable non-fossil sources can lead to a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions
column3: which can contribute to the restoration of marine ecosystems and biodiversity. This is because the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions can help to mitigate the impacts of climate change on marine ecosystems.

column1: TA4.3;The yearly average GHG intensity of the energy used on board by a ship during a reporting period shall be reduced;TA6.41;+;The implementation of TA4.3 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.41
column2: as the reduction of GHG intensity in the shipping sector can contribute to the restoration of marine ecosystems and biodiversity. This is because the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions can help to mitigate the impacts of climate change on marine ecosystems.

column1: TA4.5;Aviation fuel suppliers shall also ensure that Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF) made available to aircraft operators at each Union airport will be at least 2% from 2025;TA6.42;+;The implementation of TA4.5 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.42
column2: as the increased use of Sustainable Aviation Fuel can lead to a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions
column3: which can contribute to the restoration of ecosystems and biodiversity. This is because the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions can help to mitigate the impacts of climate change on ecosystems.

column1: TA4.7;Each Member State shall set an obligation on fuel suppliers to ensure that: (B) the combined share of advanced biofuels and biogas produced from the feedstock listed in Part A of Annex IX and of renewable fuels of non-biological origin in the energy supplied to the transport sector is at least 1% in 2025 and 5.5% in 2030;TA6.43;+;The implementation of TA4.7 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.43
column2: as the increased use of advanced biofuels and renewable fuels can lead to a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions
column3: which can contribute to the restoration of ecosystems and biodiversity. This is because the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions can help to mitigate the impacts of climate change on ecosystems.

column1: TA4.8;Member States with maritime ports shall endeavour to ensure that as of 2030 the share of renewable fuels of non-biological origin (RFNBOs) in the total amount of energy supplied to the maritime transport sector is at least 1.2%;TA6.44;+;The implementation of TA4.8 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.44
column2: as the increased use of renewable fuels of non-biological origin can lead to a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions
column3: which can contribute to the restoration of ecosystems and biodiversity. This is because the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions can help to mitigate the impacts of climate change on ecosystems.

column1: TA4.9;Cut the emissions of transport sector by 90% by 2050 relative to 1990;TA6.45;+;The implementation of TA4.9 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.45
column2: as the reduction of emissions in the transport sector can contribute to the restoration of ecosystems and biodiversity. This is because the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions can help to mitigate the impacts of climate change on ecosystems.

column1: TA4.10;EU fisheries are encouraged to continue the positive trend
column2: as observed for the period 2009-2019
column3: towards reducing fuel intensity by reducing the fossil-fuel consumption per kg of landed product for at least an additional 15% for the period 2019-2030;TA6.46;+;The implementation of TA4.10 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.46
column4: as the reduction of fuel intensity in the fishing sector can lead to a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions
column5: which can contribute to the restoration of marine ecosystems and biodiversity. This is because the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions can help to mitigate the impacts of climate change on marine ecosystems.

column1: TA4.11;Reduce the average door-to-door cost of combined transport operations by at least 10% within 7 years;TA6.29;-;The implementation of TA4.11 may have a negative impact on TA6.29
column2: as the reduction of transport costs can lead to an increase in transportation activities
column3: which can result in increased emissions and pollution
column4: potentially harming ecosystems and biodiversity. This is because the increased transportation activities can lead to increased greenhouse gas emissions and pollution.

column1: TA4.13;For [...] “urban buses” manufacturers shall comply with the 90% (in the reporting period 2030-2034) and 100% (as from 2035) minimum shares in their fleet of new heavy-duty vehicles;TA6.47;+;The implementation of TA4.13 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.47
column2: as the increased use of zero-emission buses can lead to a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions and air pollution
column3: which can contribute to the restoration of urban ecosystems and biodiversity. This is because the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions and air pollution can help to mitigate the impacts of climate change and pollution on urban ecosystems.

column1: TA4.15;The average CO2 emissions of the Union fleet of new heavy-duty motor vehicles [...]
column2: off-road vehicles and off-road special purpose vehicles shall be reduced by the following percentages compared to the average CO2 emissions of the reporting period of the year 2019;TA6.48;+;The implementation of TA4.15 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.48
column3: as the reduction of CO2 emissions from heavy-duty vehicles can contribute to the restoration of ecosystems and biodiversity. This is because the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions can help to mitigate the impacts of climate change on ecosystems.

column1: TA4.18;The share of biofuels and biogas produced from the feedstock listed in Part B of Annex IX in the energy content of fuels and electricity supplied to the transport sector shall
column2: except in Cyprus and Malta
column3: be limited to 1.7%;TA6.49;-;The implementation of TA4.18 may have a negative impact on TA6.49
column4: as the limitation on biofuels and biogas can lead to an increased reliance on fossil fuels
column5: resulting in increased greenhouse gas emissions and pollution
column6: potentially harming ecosystems and biodiversity. This is because the increased use of fossil fuels can lead to increased greenhouse gas emissions and pollution.

column1: TA4.19;The yearly quantity of aviation fuel uplifted by a given aircraft operator at a given Union airport shall be at least 90% of the yearly aviation fuel required
column2: to avoid tankering practices which would bring additional emissions from extra weight;TA6.50;+;The implementation of TA4.19 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.50
column3: as the reduction of tankering practices can lead to a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions
column4: which can contribute to the restoration of ecosystems and biodiversity. This is because the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions can help to mitigate the impacts of climate change on ecosystems.

column1: TA4.20;In the first phase
column2: from 2020 up to 2024
column3: the strategic objective is to install at least 6 GW of renewable hydrogen electrolysers in the EU;TA6.51;+;The implementation of TA4.20 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.51
column4: as the increased use of renewable hydrogen can lead to a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions
column5: which can contribute to the restoration of ecosystems and biodiversity. This is because the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions can help to mitigate the impacts of climate change on ecosystems.

column1: TA4.25;Member States shall ensure that
column2: at the end of each year
column3: the following power output targets are met cumulatively: (a) for each light-duty battery electric vehicle registered in their territory
column4: a total power output of at least 1.3 kW is provided through publicly accessible recharging stations; and (b) for each light-duty plug-in hybrid vehicle registered in their territory
column5: a total power output of at least 0.80 kW is provided through publicly accessible recharging stations.;TA6.52;+;The implementation of TA4.25 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.52
column6: as the increased provision of recharging infrastructure can lead to an increase in the adoption of electric vehicles
column7: resulting in a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions and air pollution
column8: which can contribute to the restoration of ecosystems and biodiversity. This is because the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions and air pollution can help to mitigate the impacts of climate change and pollution on ecosystems.

column1: TA4.26;Member States shall ensure that along the TEN-T core and comprehensive network
column2: publicly accessible recharging pools dedicated to light-duty vehicles deployed in each direction of travel with a maximum distance of 60 km in-between them offering a power output of at least 600kW and including at least one recharging point with an individual power output of at least 150 kW.;TA6.53;+;The implementation of TA4.26 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.53
column3: as the increased provision of recharging infrastructure can lead to an increase in the adoption of electric vehicles
column4: resulting in a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions and air pollution
column5: which can contribute to the restoration of ecosystems and biodiversity. This is because the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions and air pollution can help to mitigate the impacts of climate change and pollution on ecosystems.

column1: TA4.27;Member States shall ensure that
column2: by 31 December 2030 (with intermediate 2025 and 2027 targets)
column3: along the TEN-T core road network
column4: publicly accessible recharging pools dedicated to heavy-duty electric vehicles are deployed in each direction of travel with a maximum distance of 60 km between them [...].;TA6.54;+;The implementation of TA4.27 is likely to have a positive impact on TA6.54
column5: as the increased provision of recharging infrastructure can lead to an increase in the adoption of electric vehicles
column6: resulting in a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions and air pollution

column1: TA6.29;Terrestrial ecosystems. Member States shall put in place [...] measures [...] to jointly cover
column2: as a Union target
column3: throughout the areas and ecosystems [...] defined in Art. 2

column7: all ecosystems in need of restoration.;TA3.51;+;The implementation of TA6.29 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.51

column9: which can contribute to the reduction of waste and pollution. This is because the restoration of ecosystems can help to mitigate the impacts of climate change and pollution on ecosystems.

column7: all ecosystems in need of restoration.;TA3.52;+;The implementation of TA6.30 is likely to have a positive impact on TA3.52

column1: TA6.31;Terrestrial
column2: coastal and freshwater ecosystems. Member States shall put in place the restoration measures [...] to improve to good condition areas of habitat types listed in Annex I which are not in good condition.;TA4.3;-;The implementation of TA6.31 may have a negative impact on TA4.3
column3: as the restoration of ecosystems can lead to an increase in the use of resources
column4: such as water and land

column1: TA6.32;Terrestrial
column2: coastal and freshwater ecosystems. Member States shall put in place the restoration measures [...] to re-establish the habitat types listed in Annex I in areas not covered by those habitat types with the aim to reach their favourable reference area.;TA4.5;-;The implementation of TA6.32 may have a negative impact on TA4.5
column3: as the restoration of ecosystems can lead to an increase in the use of resources

column5: which can result in increased emissions and pollution from the aviation sector. This is because the increased use of resources can lead to increased greenhouse gas emissions and pollution.

column1: TA6.33;Terrestrial

column4: IV and V to Directive 92/43/EEC and of the terrestrial
column5: coastal and freshwater habitats of wild birds covered by Directive 2009/147/EC [...] to improve the quality and quantity of those habitats

column11: which can result in increased emissions and pollution from the transport sector. This is because the increased use of resources can lead to increased greenhouse gas emissions and pollution.

column1: TA6.34;Terrestrial
column2: coastal and freshwater ecosystems. Member States shall ensure that condition is known for at least 90% of the area distributed overall habitat types listed in Annex I by 2030 and 100% by 2040.;TA4.9;-;The implementation of TA6.34 may have a negative impact on TA4.9
column3: as the restoration of ecosystems can lead to an increase in the use of resources

column1: TA6.35;Terrestrial
column2: coastal and freshwater ecosystems. Member States shall ensure that there is: (a) an increase of habitat area in good condition for habitat types listed in Annex I until at least 90% is in good condition and until the favourable reference area for each habitat type in each biogeographic region of the Member State concerned is reached; (b) an increasing trend towards the sufficient quality and quantity of the terrestrial
column3: coastal and freshwater habitats of the species referred to in Annexes II
column4: IV and V to Directive 92/43/EEC and of the species covered by Directive 2009/147/EC.;TA4.10;-;The implementation of TA6.35 may have a negative impact on TA4.10
column5: as the restoration of ecosystems can lead to an increase in the use of resources
column7: which can result in increased emissions and pollution from the fishing sector. This is because the increased use of resources can lead to increased greenhouse gas emissions and pollution.

column1: TA6.36;(urban ecosystems) By 2030

column3: and of urban tree canopy cover in urban ecosystem areas.;TA4.11;-;The implementation of TA6.36 may have a negative impact on TA4.11

column5: such as water and land
column6: which can result in increased emissions and pollution from the transport sector. This is because the increased use of resources can lead to increased greenhouse gas emissions and pollution.

column3: in urban ecosystem areas
column4: determined in accordance with Article 14(4)
column5: measured every six years after 31 December 2030
column6: until a satisfactory level identified in accordance with Article 14(5) is reached.;TA4.13;-;The implementation of TA6.37 may have a negative impact on TA4.13
column7: as the restoration of urban ecosystems can lead to an increase in the use of resources
column9: which can result in increased emissions and pollution from the transport sector. This is because the increased use of resources can lead to increased greenhouse gas emissions and pollution.

column1: TA6.38;(urban ecosystems) Member States shall achieve
column2: in each urban ecosystem area

column1: TA6.39;Natural connectivity of rivers and natural functions of the related floodplains. Member States shall make an inventory of artificial barriers and remove them to connectivity of surface waters and
column2: taking into account their socio-economic functions

column6: which can result in increased emissions and pollution from the energy sector. This is because the increased use of resources can lead to increased greenhouse gas emissions and pollution.

column1: TA6.40;(pollinator) Member States shall
column2: by putting in place in a timely manner appropriate and effective measures
column3: improve pollinator diversity and reverse the decline of pollina- tor populations at the latest by 2030 and thereafter achieve an increasing trend of pollinator populations
column4: measured at least every six years from 2030
column5: until satisfactory levels are achieved

column1: TA6.41;Marine ecosystems. Member States shall put in place the restoration measures [...] to improve [...] areas of habitat types listed in Annex II which are not in good condition.;TA4.3;+;The implementation of TA6.41 is likely to have a positive impact on TA4.3
